title: ChocoFile + ChocoPack file formats (.chd / .chp)
description: Plain text structured data + general purpose file packing + file encryption

content.data: As a lover of memory management and optimization, I'm one of those who dislike JSON. I don't remember how did I came with the peculiar name for this format specification but I still find it cool. The file format (.CHD) basically stores structured data with the simplicity of a I18N plain definition file. The pack format (.CHP) just concatenate files one after another with a data table on the end. Separatelly, there's a file encryptor/decryptor.

data: I stated I dislike JSON yet this article is actually written in it.
